thread.title: Detroit Tigers Pitcher Daniel Norris Played With Cancer All Summer
thread.title_full: Detroit Tigers Pitcher Daniel Norris Played With Cancer All Summer

author: Juliet Spies-Gans
title: Detroit Tigers Pitcher Daniel Norris Played With Cancer All Summer
text:
Detroit Tigers Pitcher Daniel Norris Played With Cancer All Summer Talk about resilience. By Jahmal Corner Posted: 10/20/2015 10:18 AM EDT | Edited: 13 minutes ago Jon Durr via Getty Images Norris pitching against the Chicago White Sox on Oct 4, 2015, in Chicago, Illinois. 
Detroit Tigers pitcher Daniel Norris will undergo surgery for a cancerous growth on his thyroid after being diagnosed earlier this year. 
Norris made the revelation on his Instagram account on Monday, explaining that he was diagnosed in May but had opted to finish the regular season before having the procedure done. 
"Baseball kept me sane," the 22-year-old said. "I was given the option to shut my year down and get it removed immediately. 
"However, seeing another doctor that determined I could wait until the end of the season reassured my gut feeling. Just keep playing." 
The Tigers, who acquired Norris in a trade with Toronto in July, said they were aware of his condition when they made the move and expect him to make a full recovery. 
Norris started 13 games this season, finishing 3-2 with a 3.75 ERA.
